reviewText: In The Dark Horse a man with passion and a large heart makes his mark in the hearts of children. A powerful lesson about the gifts that life may bestow upon us when the odds are against any type of salvation.
Strong acting.  Interesting story, with honest drama.

An outstanding movie based on a true story. Much of the movie revolved around the gang culture that exists in New Zealand and how difficult it is to break away from it. Another central theme is the difficult life of the people afflicted with mental illness. The lead character suffers from severe bipolar disorder but manages to achieve greatness despite the challenges both his illness and his environment present. The accents are at times strong but true to the story. A heroic movie with excellent acting and direction. It won every award for a movie in New Zealand, best actor, best director, best movie etc.

This film explores the cyclical nature of poverty from one generation to the next.  The game of chess offers a brief respite for many characters, but the disadvantages they face never truly go away.  Cliff Curtis gives a memorable performance.
This movie is great on a real chess player from New Zealand who overcame mental health issues to help kids out! The acting is superb and the story is great. My wife, not into chess loved the movie.
